# Action Network node

Use the Action Network node to automate work in Action Network, and integrate Action Network with other applications. n8n has built-in support for a wide range of Action Network features, including creating, updating, and deleting events, people, tags, and signatures. 

On this page, you'll find a list of operations the Action Network node supports, and links to more resources.

/// note | Credentials
Refer to [Action Network credentials](/integrations/builtin/credentials/actionnetwork.md) for guidance on setting up authentication. 
///

--8<-- "_snippets/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/ai-tools.md"

## Operations

* Attendance
    * Create
    * Get
    * Get All
* Event
    * Create
    * Get
    * Get All
* Person
    * Create
    * Get
    * Get All
    * Update
* Person Tag
    * Add
    * Remove
* Petition
    * Create
    * Get
    * Get All
    * Update
* Signature
    * Create
    * Get
    * Get All
    * Update
* Tag
    * Create
    * Get
    * Get All

## Templates and examples

options.description: Description of the event. HTML supported.

values.name: primary
values.description: Whether this is the person's primary address

values.name: address_lines
values.description: Line for a person's address

values.name: locality
values.description: City or other local administrative area. If blank, this will be filled in based on Action Network's geocoding.

values.name: region
values.description: State or subdivision code per ISO 3166-2

values.name: postal_code
values.description: Region specific postal code, such as ZIP code

values.name: country
values.description: Country code according to ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2. Defaults to US.

values.name: language
values.description: Language in which the address is recorded, per ISO 639

values.name: latitude
values.description: Latitude of the location of the address

values.name: longitude
values.description: Longitude of the location of the address

options.description: Internal (not public) title of the event

options.name: start_date
options.description: Start date and time of the event
